identificationModule.briefTitle: Impact of Vitamin D Supplementation on Severity of Pediatric Atopic Dermatitis
identificationModule.officialTitle: Impact of Vitamin D Supplementation on Clinical Severity and Immunologic Tolerance of Pediatric Atopic Dermatitis

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether oral vitamin D supplementation improves the clinical severity of atopic dermatitis in children. In addition, this study plans to evaluate the effects of vitamin D supplementation on several key aspects of the immune system of children with atopic dermatitis.

armGroups.label: Vitamin D3 supplementation
armGroups.description: Subjects in the experimental arm will receive weekly vitamin D3 doses in oral suspension during 6 weeks. Weekly dose varies according to age group: VD3 8000 IU between ages 2-5.9 years, VD3 12000 IU between ages 6-11.9 years, VD3 16000 IU between ages 12-17.9 years.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Subjects in the placebo arm will receive weekly placebo oral suspension during 6 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.description: Change in Scoring Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) index after 6 weeks of vitamin D3 (VD3) supplementation or placebo in children with atopic dermatitis.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Eosinophil blood counts, serum IgE, Th2 lymphocytes among stimulated PBMCs, serum CCL17, CCL22, and CCL27.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in dendritic cell-mediated tolerance and regulatory T cells
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number and phenotype of blood dendritic cells and number of regulatory T cells.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Effect of VD3 supplementation on immunity to Staphylococcus aureus
secondaryOutcomes.description: Serum cathelicidin levels, S. aureus skin carriage, and specific IgE to staphylococcal enterotoxins.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Vitamin D receptor single nucleotide polymorphisms
secondaryOutcomes.description: Effect of VDR SNPs on the VD3 response.
Gene expression of epidermal proteins by PCR obtained from lesional and non-lesional tape stripping samples.

otherOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
otherOutcomes.description: Adverse events of atopic dermatitis patients with VD3 and placebo

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Atopic dermatitis diagnosed according to Hanifin and Rajka criteria
* Age 2 - 17 years
* SCORAD 10 - 103

Exclusion Criteria:

* Active skin infection
* History of underlying illness causing immunosuppression within the past 2 years
* Immunosuppressors taken within the past month
* Parathyroid disease
* Sarcoidosis
* Acute or chronic renal disease
* Hyper or hypocalcemia
* Thyroid disease
* Osteomalacia or Paget's disease of bone
* Malabsorption
* Use of VD supplements (\> 400 IU daily) or fish oil supplements in the past month
* Treatment for known VD deficiency in the last 6 months
* Treatment with moderate or high potency topical corticosteroids, oral or topical antibiotics, oral antivirals, immune enhancers, or topical calcineurin inhibitors in the past 7 days
* Phototherapy in the past month
* Autoimmune disease or immunodeficiency
* Planned trip to sunny climate during the 6-week study.
